poem:
Title: Steel Amidst the Snowflake

Chisel-throated don't wane, those Ukrainian stars,
In a steeled dance with a bully's fist.
2024 a mirage, yet the heart tree mars
Its circles in the grit of today's list.
Call it fatigue, or title it despair,
Yet behold the kick of the can-caught larks,
Every scar etched wrinkles a prayer,
They birth their war on illustrious sparks.
prompt: You are the poet Jericho Brown. You woke up this morning feeling humorous. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thursday briefing: Ukrainians believe they can win, but a breakthrough in 2024 looks remote Good morning. There’s something insidious about the idea of “Ukraine fatigue”: it could easily lead to the view that what really counts about the Russian invasion is how much interest it excites in the west. In truth, for Ukrainians, resisting the invasion continues to exact a devastating price in the service of an existential cause. While there are no official figures". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
